results.content: very systematic way of presenting the material please keep up the good work
results.content_html: very systematic way of presenting the material please keep up the good work

results.content:
Many repeats in lessons.
Very bad coding in every lesson: constant mistakes and loss of time for their correction.
It is a lot of unnecessary actions: creating, deleting and renaming of folders, files and names within a code, so loss of time and unclear content.
Very basic practical section. So, it's non a practical guide, mostly theoretical.

response.content: Hello Viktor! We are sorry you didn't like the course, but thanks for the feedback! I will most definitely consider it when creating new courses. That said many students run into difficult to assess errors relating to wrong folder, file and variable references when working with a new technology, and by doing a lot of the file management live it minimizes the chances of a beginner student running in to one of these annoying errors that may confuse and discourage the student. But most certainly I will consider ways of minimizing the time spent on that to not waste the time of students who don't find it useful.

results.content_html:
Many repeats in lessons.
Very bad coding in every lesson: constant mistakes and loss of time for their correction.
It is a lot of unnecessary actions: creating, deleting and renaming of folders, files and names within a code, so loss of time and unclear content.
Very basic practical section. So, it's non a practical guide, mostly theoretical.
